messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2895
messages.msgSnippet: on 1/19/03 5:26 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at ... I tend to think that substances can affect different people differently. My son can eat a ton of
messages.messageBody:
on 1/19/03 5:26 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> I asked him if he thought I was crazy to think that when parents said sugar
> made kids hyper that it was just the same as when parents used to say coffee
> would stunt their growth--a tale untested by real parents with real kids.


I tend to think that substances can affect different people differently. My
son can eat a ton of candy, a fraction of which would make me sick, without
a moment of uncomfortableness. I would believe a parent who says their kid
is affected by sugar and I would believe a parent who says their kid is
totally unaffected by sugar. Caffeine has little affect on some, a large
affect on others. Ritalin works on some, not on others. Etc.

Paula
